The six forms are Student Health Information, Occupational Survey, Acceptable Use Policy, Electronic Distribution of Student Handbook, Truancy Contract, Corporal Punishment.
If you do not have access to print these forms, we have copies in the office for your convenience.

Thank you,

Frediena Emerson

Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.

P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT

Great news for our seniors!

Yesterday, the Governor's office gave school districts the "green light" to hold face to face graduation ceremonies beginning June 1st. With this new information, we have committed to holding our commencement exercises on Friday June 5th at the football field.

We are as excited as you are that we will get to hold a more traditional ceremony sooner than we anticipated, but please realize there are still distancing guidelines in place that will limit the size of the crowd that can be in attendance. We have cleared this outdoor ceremony with the offices of both the mayor and county judge, so, weather permitting, June 5th is the date of graduation for the class of 2020! Details including time, number of guests allowed, and specifics of the ceremony to follow.

On a related topic, since we will be graduating on June 5th, the virtual ceremony scheduled for May 22nd has been cancelled. There is no need for you and your family to come during the time slot you signed up for.

Bangs ISD will host a ‘Meet and Greet’ at a later date in order to give the community an opportunity to welcome Dr. Martin and his family to Bangs.

“It’s a great day to be a Dragon,” Martin said. “I cannot express how excited and grateful I am for this opportunity, and how much I am looking forward to working with the students, families, and staff of Bangs ISD.”

Home-Based-Learning TIPS

1. Set up a dedicated space for schoolwork.
2. Create a daily for schedule – include a time for exercise (outside if the weather allows since your child needs sunshine).
3. Tell your child to show you each completed assignment.
4. Resist the urge to immediately help your child when they struggle. Give your child time to investigate, research, or figure out on his/her own.
5. Plan for 5-6 hours each day.
6. Work whenever it is most beneficial for your child. Take breaks as needed. Movement every 30 minutes is beneficial.
7. You will get out of this what you put into this.

"You might think it’s just a count of U.S. residents, but the 2020 census is much more than that: The count and various estimates produced from it channel billions of dollars in federal funds to Texas, its local governments and its citizens... BANGS — The Bangs Lady Dragons remained atop the District 6-3A girls basketball standings with their fourth straight league win, 52-29 over the rival Early Lady Horns — who are still seeking their first league victory.

Early (9-13, 0-4) jumped out to a 5-0 lead but Bangs (10-13, 4-0) answered with 13 consecutive points and never looked back. The Lady Dragons were in front 16-8 after one quarter, 28-15 at halftime and 43-26 heading into the fourth.

Trenedi Deal scored 17 points to pace Bangs followed by eight from Kyra Smith.

Further information was not available at press time.
